meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a roof or covering.
meanings.sent1: The tectorial tiles on the house were red and shiny.
meanings.sent2: The tectorial structure of the building provided great protection from the rain.
meanings.sent3: The tectorial umbrella was so big, it could cover the entire family!
meanings.sent4: Her tectorial hat shielded her face from the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The tectorial awning over the patio made it a cozy spot for relaxation.

meanings.definition: Serving as a protective covering or shield.
meanings.sent1: The tectorial armor worn by the knight gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The tectorial film on the phone screen prevented scratches.
meanings.sent3: The tectorial bubble wrap around the fragile item kept it safe during shipping.
meanings.sent4: Her tectorial embrace comforted him during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The tectorial shield blocked all incoming arrows during the battle.
